entry.def: You use elderly as a polite way of saying that someone is old.

example.ex: Many of those most affected are elderly.
example.tran: 受影响最大的人中很多都是上了年纪的。

entry.def: If you describe an object as elderly, you are referring, often in a humorous way, to the fact that it is rather old or old-fashioned and not as good or efficient as a new one would be.

example.ex: Some of those artillery pieces look a little elderly.
example.tran: 那些大炮中有些看起来有点老掉牙了。

means.word_mean: 1. advanced in years; (`aged' is pronounced as two syllables);

Sentence.sentence: So it makes sense that the elderly should be routinely screened for new tumors — or doesn't it?
While such vigilant（警觉的）tracking of cancer is a good thing in general, researchers are increasingly questioning whether all of this testing is necessary for the elderly

A recent study suggests that doctors start to make more objective decisions about who will truly benefit from screening- especially considering the explosion of the elderly that will soon swell our population.
Most of the elderly people he interviewed said they had supportive and friendly dealings and got along well or very well with their sisters and brothers.
To encourage the young to take care of the elderly
Present budget policies tax parents heavily to support the elderly.

sentences.cn: 这位上了年纪的老人仍精力充沛。

jushi.english: There were a few middle-aged and even elderly women in the train.
jushi.chinese: 火车上有几个中年以上的妇女。

jushi.english: He is an elderly man, about sixty.
